Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالتَّسَرُّعَ إِلَى الْعُقُوبَةِ فَإِنَّهُ مَمْقَتَةٌ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ وَمُقَرِّبٌ مِنَ الْغِيَرِ
enWisdom: Be careful not to hasten towards punishment, for indeed this is detestable in the sight of Allah and brings [unwanted] changes [and removal of blessings] closer

Wisdom: قِلَّةُ الْعَفْوِ أَقْبَحُ الْعُيُوبِ وَالتَّسَرُّعُ إِلَى الِانْتِقَامِ أَعْظَمُ الذُّنُوبِ
enWisdom: Lack of forgiveness is the ugliest of flaws and rushing to exact revenge is the gravest of sins

Wisdom: لَيْسَ مِنْ شِيَمِ الْكِرَامِ تَعْجِيلُ الِانْتِقَامِ
enWisdom: Being hasty in taking revenge is not from the traits of noble-minded people
One who punishes the guilty [instead of forgiving him], his merit [and kindness] gets corrupted
Whoever punishes the one who is apologetic has committed a grave injustice

Wisdom: مَنْ عَاقَبَ بِالذَّنْبِ فَلَا فَضْلَ لَهُ
enWisdom: One who punishes [a person] for [having committed] an offence has no merit
Hastening punishment is one of the signs of vileness
How repulsive is punishment [that is meted out] despite apology
Being hasty in taking revenge is from the traits of the wicked
